Description: Very small scarab, made of glazed steatite, completely preserved. Remains of a beige glaze preserved. The division between head and prothorax is shown with a single line. No other details shown on the back. The shape of the head is roughly oval, the clypeus is indicated but no details are shown. The side of the scarab shows three legs on top of a base plate, no further details visible. The seal at the base does not show an oval line framing the base. Very stylized hieroglyphs show an 'Imn-Ra with two vertical stokes underneath and a nb-basket at the other end. The orientation of the seal is transversal while the perforation of the object is longitudinal.
